outline.ch:
巴修拉（Gaston Bachelard）在《水與夢》（L’Eau et les Rêves）中把想像力區分為兩個層次：形式想像（imagination formelle）與物質想像（imagination matérielle）。形式想像比較是感官再現實在世界的影像，類似於笛卡兒在《沉思錄》（Les méditations métaphisiques）中把想像力與虛構的幻象（illusion）相連，物質想像則形構超越在實在世界之上的影像。第一種想像從屬於事物的形體，在事物的管轄之下（sous）展開各種變化，第二種想像則超越在事物之上（sur），以非事物指認事物之根本所是。從這個區辨中，我們得知，第二種想像，亦即物質想像，涉及對事物的超越性認識，然而，這種超越性認識並不是「與事物無關」的認識，反之，透過這種超越性的認識，Bachelard期待可以瓦解眼睛所見的形式局限，更深刻地抵達事物存在的根本性認識。確切地說，Bachelard認為，通過物質想像，人與事物之間的界線可能被打破，而達到相互共感的境界。
此課程作為哲學基本課程，目的在於透過Bachelard的問題意識理解傳統哲學對想像力的思辨，並且通過其開放的論述分析，探索一種創造性想像的可能性。本課程將以前後兩半部進行。其一，透過節錄原典之閱讀，進行巴修拉之核心概念探討。其二，透過分析二手文獻，強化對巴修拉思想之認識。
01週，課程介紹。
02週，傳統哲學中的想像力根源I
03週，傳統哲學中的想像力根源II

outline.en:
In Water and Dreams (L‘Eau et les Rêves), Gaston Bachelard distinguished imagination into two levels: formal imagination (imagination formelle) and material imagination (imagination matérielle). Formal imagination is the image of the real world reproduced by the senses. It is similar to Descartes‘s connection of imagination with fictional illusions in Metaphysical Meditations (Les Meditations Métaphisiques); while material imagination operates on images that transcend the real world. The first kind of imagination is subordinate to the form of things and undergoes various changes under (sous) the control of things. The second kind of imagination is to transcend (sur) things and understand the fundamental nature of things by breaking down the things themselves. From this distinction, we know that the second kind of imagination, that is, material imagination, involves transcendent knowledge of things. However, this transcendent knowledge is not a knowledge that is “independent of things“. On the contrary, through this kind of transcendent knowledge, Bachelard hopes to break down the formal limitations seen by the eyes and reach a deeper understanding of the fundamental understanding of the existence of things. To be precise, Bachelard believes that through material imagination, the boundaries between people and things may be broken down, and a state of mutual sympathy may be achieved.
The purpose of this course is to understand the traditional philosophical thinking on imagination, and to explore the possibility of creative imagination through Bachelard‘s discussion and analysis. This course will be conducted in two parts. First, explore Bachelard’s core concepts through reading excerpts from the original text. Second, by analyzing secondary literature, we strengthen our understanding of Bachelard’s thoughts.
Week 01, Introduction.
Week 02, The Origin of Imagination in Traditional Philosophy I
Week 03, The Origin of Imagination in Traditional Philosophy II
Week 04, The Origin of Imagination in Traditional Philosophy III
Week 05, Bachelard’s Formal Imagination and Material Imagination I
Week 06, Bachelard’s Formal Imagination and Material Imagination II
Week 07, Bachelard’s Formal Imagination and Material Imagination III
Week 08, Bachelard’s Formal Imagination and Material Imagination IV
Week 09, Carrier of Imagination: poetry composed of elements (Fire) I
Week 10, Carrier of Imagination: poetry composed of elements (Water) II
Week 11, Carrier of Imagination: poetry composed of elements (Wind) III
Week 12, Carrier of Imagination: poetry composed of elements (Earth) IV
Week 13, Secondary Literature Analysis I.
Week 14, Secondary Literature Analysis II.

Week 16, secondary Literature Analysis IV.

Week 18: Final paper writing (independent research).
